text:
Unless already available somewhere, I think a useful project would be to have semi-official how-to instructions for building R from the official source tarball on Linux, macOS, and MS Windows. They should assume a fresh, vanilla operating system, so instructions how to install all necessary system dependencies have to give to.  Basically, each OS, and possible individual OS versions, would have their own pages (e.g. Linux Ubuntu 22.04 or macOS 13) with 1-2-3 instructions.

This can help R users stuck on HPC systems with very dated R versions, or, say Bioconductor users, who wish to install multiple parallel R versions (e.g. R devel and R release) so they can access both Bioc devel and release.

Just a thought
